website_summaries.verdict: The Canon PowerShot A495 is a bargain for anyone concerned more with photo quality than features.

customer_reviews.title: A STEAL OF A DEAL
customer_reviews.text: Exceptionally priced quality camera. It's a CANON for pete's sake... Camera appears well made. Ease of use is very good. My son loves it, and he likes to keep it simple. Finally, something to perhaps keep in mind, Canon cameras are among the very few cameras now being made that can actually still be repaired if necessary. Parts are actually made readily available for repair/replacement, not so with most other cameras now being made. Even the high end/ more expensive cameras made by several well known and regarded companies seem to be assumed to be disposeable after their presumed or planned obsolesence. just consult your local camera repairman, if you can find one...
customer_reviews.author: Stasia Sheridan

customer_reviews.title: cheap camera that takes nice pics of stationary objects
customer_reviews.text: i know very little about photography, but i do know when a camera is easy to use and takes excellent pictures. pros: - inexpensive - takes excellent pictures of stationary objects cons: - flash is slow to recharge - the camera is miserably slow at focusing at in on distant objects when you use the optical zoom - if you loose patience with how long it takes the camera's auto-focus to focus in on an object or person, the pictures will invariably come out blurry - battery life is short when you use the flash regularly bottom line: - still probably worth it if you want a very basic point-and-shoot camera under $100
customer_reviews.author: DukeU

customer_reviews.title: Good camera for the price.
customer_reviews.text: When I needed a simple camera for work, this camera seemed like a good solution. I have been using the camera for four months with no problems. This is a great starter or basic point-and-shoot camera. Pros: -Simple and easy to use out of the box -Uses 2 AA batteries, easily replaceable -Takes great pictures in high light -Macro function works well -The camera is small and light - fits well into pockets -Controls are easy to use Cons: -Lense movement is crude and noisy compared to higher-end point-and-shoot cameras -Picture quality is noisy in low light -Viewer display resolution is acceptable but low-end
customer_reviews.author: Drew E

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Grandma
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I purchased this camera for my mother-in-law because she needed a camera to take photos of the grand kids. This camera doesn't have a lot of features, which is one reason it is so great for grandma. It starts up fairly fast and take great photos in auto mode. This isn't a professional camera, so you can't expect professional results, but just like most Canon cameras it blows its competition out of the water. If all you need is a simple point and shoot camera that takes great photos - there's no need to hesitate with this superb Canon.
customer_reviews.author: thatpharmguy

customer_reviews.title: Will not stay charfed, Poor Picture Quality
customer_reviews.text: This cannot compare to my digital Olympus! The picture quality is ok, the battery compartment loosened up and won't stay closed, and on a sunny day you cannot see the screen to see if your picture is set up right. Bad design! Will go back to Olympus next camera.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Pea Mom

customer_reviews.title: Clear and Colorful Pictures - Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This camera produces very good pictures compared to cameras at and slightly below this price range. Some cameras in this range produce pictures that are "washed out" and "noisy" (mainly any brand that is not from a larger company). The camera's performance is a little slow to focus and charge the flash, just make sure to pre-focus before taking the shot. I purchased this camera as a "carry camera". I have higher end P&S and DSLR cameras which I am scared to take with me sometimes, for fear of damage, so I take this one. It does well for this and the AA batteries are nice because I can replace them anytime.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little camera!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little camera! Great pictures! Easy to use! Easy to upload and download! Get a spare memory card and bring spare batteries. One trick I learned is to remove the batteries and switch them around when the indicator signals a low battery state. I get twice the life out of my batteries that way. You won't regret getting this camera unless you are looking for a professional SLR Digital or something far beyond the needs of a mere mortal who just wants to take good pics without a huge hassle.
customer_reviews.author: G. E. Glaum

customer_reviews.title: lot of camera for the money.
customer_reviews.text: If you want a convenient camera and are a general user, this would be a good camera for you.It takes a great picture without requiring you to do anything but turn it on and snap the picture. The pictures are easy to retrieve from the camera and I have not found the battery consumption to be a problem. It helps conserve the batteries if it is not left on continuosly. I turn it off if I am not planning on taking a picture for a few minutes.It is small and I like the blue color. It is designed well ergonomically.
customer_reviews.author: Swampwizard

customer_reviews.title: Pretty happy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for the specifically because I wanted something small and easy to bring around. I have a Canon DSLR and so I wasn't looking for something that takes amazing photos or anything. However, it's pretty inconvenient to carry around all the time. This camera is perfect for stuffing in your bag to be ready to take quick photos so you don't miss documenting anything. The quality of the photos is actually really very good especially for the price. It does have a few cons. It's pretty slow between taking photos and the battery life is pretty short with regular AA batteries. Other than that, it's easy to use, light, cute and handy. It's awesome for the price!
customer_reviews.author: April M

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot A495
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely hate this camera. I had the previous version and loved it but my grand daughter accidently dropped it in the bathtub. This camera uses up the batteries like crazy. I have rechargables and they die sooner than non rechargables. Just when you want to take the best picture you get the message that your flash is recharging and by then the shot you wanted to take is gone. the pictures are blurry and disoriented. I wish I had never gotten this camera. Bad Purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bernice H. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Great so far...but only for a couple of months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on a lightning deal not too long ago and so far I like it. I need accurate color and close up detail for posting photos in ebay. I show a photo at the top of this page of a watch face to show how a close up looks which I'm impressed. Didn't have to set in macro mode, and just 2 inches away the camera took a great photo. November update: Changing the stars to two from four. Something is wrong with the battery compartment. After just taking a few photos it says to put in new batteries.
customer_reviews.author: mythology101

customer_reviews.title: Solid camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our daughter when she turned 7. She dropped it twice the first night and the camera still works fine. The camera is slow to take pictures (before and after the drops), but the resolution is adequate. It is just what I wanted as we tried a "kid friendly" camera before and the resolution was beyond terrible. She did go through an entire set of batteries in one evening. This is really more than I expected from a camera at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin French

customer_reviews.title: Sad to say  no good
customer_reviews.text: Bought camera for my 10yr old son for christmas.The pictures ti takes are nice and clear but it broke in less than a week. It started to show a "lens error" and then the len would not retract.My my son was a good sport about it and was just concerned he had lost the pictires he had taken and thanks to Amazon painless retuns I got him another camera.I went with the Kodak Easysharedue to its non zoom lens less moving parts to fail.
customer_reviews.author: EMSTOP

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for a specific purpose.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Canon A495 specifically to test CHDK scripts. The day I found this camera online Amazon was running a special price of ~$40 for the unit. At that price, I decided to take a chance. I was able to load CHDK scripts to take time lapse and motion detection photography. This camera was probably of fine quality when it was first released. However, the pictures are lackluster compared to our current availability of inexpensive high resolution cameras and there are many better options available. I will keep this camera since it handles my desired tasks but If I weren't doing CHDK photography, I wouldn't purchase this camera again even for $40.
customer_reviews.author: Summer101

customer_reviews.title: If it was any slower i could use a pinhole camera !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Not even going to bother reviewing the features on this camera because it is sooooooo unbelievably slow. The lag time between photographs is absolutely ridiculous. I went from a sony cybershot circa 2003 to finally investing in a new camera...but this thing is so useless that I actually went back to using my 2003 sony. I highly, highly recommend looking elsewhere unless you prefer taking 1 picture every 5 minutes. Useless and frustrating!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Best for the money.
customer_reviews.text: If you bought this expecting it to perform like a Canon Mark III then you need to learn more about cameras. For the money it's a great camera. Very basic but still takes great pics. Impressive macro mode. Auto focus performs well. Lots of different options to play with. Very small and fits in a back pocket. I keep mine under my motorcycle seat. This is one of the lower priced canon's so don't expect it to perform like a $6000 camera.
customer_reviews.author: Mongoose

customer_reviews.title: kind of a piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: The problem with getting a battery powered camera is that the camera is battery powered. Which means the thing runs out of batteries if you even LOOK at it too long. Camera seems a little flimsy in the hand. Pictures are good with it, when you remember to put fresh batteries in it. This would be a good backup emergency type of camera. If you are looking for a good everyday camera, get one with a rechargable battery, much less hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Markie Twain

customer_reviews.title: Nice Little Camera For The Price...
customer_reviews.text: Just received my Canon Powershot A495 a few days ago. This little camera is perfect for the digital beginner picture-taker as myself. Nothing fancy but for $49 I couldn't go wrong. Installed an 8GB memory card & now I can take 100's of quality pictures with this thing. Already taken well over 50 in just two days & transfered to my laptop with ease. Very small & compact design makes it easy to carry in your pocket if you wish. Several different modes you can use but I keep it on auto-mode which makes it perfect for any natural shot you want to take. A heck of a deal!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Zerbst

customer_reviews.title: inexpensive Canon
customer_reviews.text: This inexpensive Canon takes decent photos and OK YouTube-quality video. I throw it in my briefcase for those "just in case" occasions when you need a simple camera with a flash that will take better pictures than a cellphone camera. It was an Amazon Prime special for $49.95 plus I purchased a 8Gb Class 10 SD card for $15, another special. The shortcoming is battery life. It uses two AA batteries, which require long flash recycle times when they get low. I haven't tried AA Lithium batteries, but that may provide longer life and faster recycles.
customer_reviews.author: A. P. Gormley

customer_reviews.title: Canon A495
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on the deal of the day and am happy with my purchase. For those of us who just want an easy to use small camera without alot of bells and whistles, this is a good choice. The pictures I have taken while on vacation may not be worthy of Nat Geo standards, but they are clear and the color is good. Flash recovery time is a bit long, but that has not been a problem for me, and I like that it takes easy to find AA batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Little Gem
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera. I have a higher end canon. I compared the picture quality between the two. The power shot A495 was just as good.It is easy to use as well. I will say ..yes as mentioned in some posts the top to the battery compartment is flimsy be careful when replacing batteries. As far as the battery life was not so bad. I am very happy with my purchase. For the price you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Honest one

customer_reviews.title: Good For the Price
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a nice camera for the price. I wish it was a little better for taking pictures with movement but for other pictures it does a nice job. I do believe the next camera I purchase will have better zoom for sports but this one does an ok job with that as well. I was wanting a camera I could carry in my purse and this one is good for that although it is a little thicker than some. I would recommend this camera for general picture taking as those pics turn out great. All in all a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Cool in Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Great value for easy no-hassle pictures
customer_reviews.text: Purchased camera along with Canon SELPHY CP800 compact photo printer as a gift for a non-computer household. The camera is easy to use, takes clear pictures with even, accurate colors and good lighting. Zoom is easy to adjust. Uses AA batteries which take a few seconds to recharge between shots, but the simplicity of use makes this a very small complaint. Transfer the SDHC card to the printer and presto...high quality prints in about a minute. No computer cables, no software to load and update, no transferring pictures before printing. Perfect for a non-technical/beginning user. I would definitely purchase this again for the appropriate person
customer_reviews.author: J.R.

customer_reviews.title: It's just okay.
customer_reviews.text: It's just okay. I bought this several years ago. Nowadays, my phone takes better pictures. I have a Galaxy S4. I no longer use this camera. I paid $60 for it (used), so I knew I wasn't getting anything special, anyway. It did what I needed it to, though. I had a crappy little Nokia phone for the longest time, so this camera was very nice to have.
customer_reviews.author: Little Piglet

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and rugged
customer_reviews.text: Good as Video Camera and Great as a Camera, Need a tripod in low light or Zoom role. ONE bothersome problem - the battery compartment lid tends to pop open if you aren't careful handling it. You'll need aa 8 memory card if you want to video a ballgame though.
customer_reviews.author: mark pillow

customer_reviews.title: good quality product and great company to do business with
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as presented, good quality product and great company to do business with. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: although the pictures come out pretty sharp if you catch the subject before it starts ...
customer_reviews.text: It is what it is, an inexpensive camera. Too much of a delay when pressing the shutter button, although the pictures come out pretty sharp if you catch the subject before it starts moving. This is a good starter camera for kids.
customer_reviews.author: Cherri Trahan

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for the money
customer_reviews.text: This purchase replaced a similar camera that was stolen. I've always been happy with the picture quality and ease of use of this camera for the cost (and in this one cost significantly less than the one I lost). It's slow between pictures (though you can speed things up by eliminating the display of a review function. It also is not great in low light level, but for the price it's a great buy. BTW: When clarity matters I found it useful to bring a monopod (tripod with one leg). It's easy to carry and does a lot to steady the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Dunsker

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: For the price, and size of this camera it does a lot. We are having so much fun with it. Using the poster mode, and vivid color on plants, and animals, and everything else in between. Everyone is always using it..Of course it doesn't do everything the bigger ones do, but for a point and shoot, and for the cost, it is great.
customer_reviews.author: Crafty Lady

customer_reviews.title: bit it was always good to me
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a long time ago and have updated since then, bit it was always good to me. I loved the filters it had.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm surprised.
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera as an alternative to carrying my Rebel with zoom lens. On the pro side: 1. It takes nice pictures for its size. 2. Very portable .. I can carry it in my back pocket. Cons: Can only zoom to 3.3 after that the digital zoom takes over and you get pixilated pictures.
customer_reviews.author: chevy77

customer_reviews.title: A nice spare
customer_reviews.text: In modern world I believe everyone should have a camera in their car's grove box ready to serve the purposes of car accident, snap shot, candid shot, and many other unexpected occasions. This camera is made out of plastic, and appears not a very high quality one, but it serves my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: See I told you

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this particular model because it was recommended by Consumer Reports in their product review. I also wanted a slim style camera that was easy to use and to take on trips. It takes good pictures and is very compact. I consider it a very good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Flower 06

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best digital camera ever for me easy to use and Compact and great photos!
customer_reviews.author: laura molison

customer_reviews.title: Excellent experience!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. Regular batteries! This seller gave a great deal! Everything I needed was included and more.
customer_reviews.author: Madysgrany

customer_reviews.title: This camera is bad. Takes horrible pictures and not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Canon cameras are going down hill quickly. This camera is bad. Takes horrible pictures and not worth the money. it is a piece of junk and not worth returning. Will not buy Cannon again.
customer_reviews.author: Slickwilly

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Canon point-and-shoot, and I'm a devoted Canon customer. Picture quality is outstanding, and the camera is easy to use for the non-professional photographer. The Amazon.com shipping was quick and efficient as well. Highly recommend this and other Canon cameras!
customer_reviews.author: Marc McC

customer_reviews.title: What a great camera!
customer_reviews.text: This camera gives excellent results in the hands of a novice. Purchased for my parents, it is easy to use and easy to get around in. 99% of all users do not need a camera with greater resolution. Buy a camera with good glass used in the lens.
customer_reviews.author: midegim

customer_reviews.title: Durable, reliable camera that takes quality shots
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for a number of years, and it has always done a good job for us. It doesn't chew threw batteries, and it takes a good quality picture. Haven't found the need to upgrade to the latest and greatest.
customer_reviews.author: R. Stern

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Uses regular AA batteries. No option of rechargeable. Very poorly made. Not many features to chose from.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Camera takes really good pictures for under $100. It is a bit slow to be ready for the next picture as others have said (couple of seconds). We have had no problem with battery life - about 500 pictures per set of batteries (most of them without flash).
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Compact Camera!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sized camera! It fits in my glove box, my pouch, and even in my computer bag with the computer in it!!! I don't like the slow flash, however. I love the color and the zoom it easy and fast!!
customer_reviews.author: mining woman

customer_reviews.title: Good camera
customer_reviews.text: I like this camera, the only problem is sometimes it takes a while to take a picture with flash because it takes sometime after a flash for the screen to get back again to take another picture. But it is a good one for regular use.
customer_reviews.author: BestFishOill .com

customer_reviews.title: Great starter camera!
customer_reviews.text: For a Canon camera that costs less than $80, you really can't go wrong with this camera. The picture quality is VERY good. The lag time between shots is poor, but shouldn't be a problem for a younger photographer, or someone who is just beginning to use digital cameras. All in all, this is a great choice if you're looking for a very basic, quality digital camera!
customer_reviews.author: K. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and get a better model
customer_reviews.text: This camera was a purchase for my not technically savvy mom. It feels very cheap (it's made of plastic) and the batteries do not last very long. I wish I had purchased a better model for just a few dollars more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Lover

customer_reviews.title: new Canon camra
customer_reviews.text: This camerawas purchased as a back up camera based upon Canon reputation and previous experience with this product family. The non-chargeable batteries (AA) provides the option of immediate shooting opportunities by insertion of a new pair of batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: picture going out of focus
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this camera from reviews and the good price. This particular camera would go out of focus when the button to take the picture was pushed. I had someone else who was camera aware check it out and they experienced the same problem. I have returned the camera and hope to find a better choice.
customer_reviews.author: slg

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CAMERA
customer_reviews.text: This camera was a gift for a fourteen year old girl.She loves it! I have seen some of the pictures and they are great! The quality of the color and definition is fantastic! She has no problem using this camera,it is very easy to use.If a fourteen year old can use it,anyone can.I recommend this camera to anyone who wants easy use and quality pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Robyne L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: so I adapted very easily. The seller located the missing cable and sent ...
customer_reviews.text: It was very similar to the one I lost, and found finally, so I adapted very easily. The seller located the missing cable and sent it to me, so I was very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Donald K Barner

customer_reviews.title: Good value camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine little camera for the money. I bought it as a birthday gift for my 15-year old grandson, who is a relative novice at digital photography. The camera is very user-friendly and produces good quality photos. It is an excelent example of "you get what you pay for," which I intend as a compliment. If you're experienced with digital photography and are interested in more sophisticated features, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest L. Harper

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have always loved my Canon's. And have owned quite a few "PowerShots" in the past. You really get what you pay for with this. My photos are always blurry. When the flash is on I constantly take photos just after the moment I am trying to capture has passed. The flash needs to charge, and takes several seconds to snap the photo. The red eye reduction does not work and all my photos come out with red eye when taken indoors. Outdoors is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: good camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera in May 2011. It's a really good camera with great video and very clean photos. Its only problem is that after a year or so the battery gate does not close on its own. I normally use a piece of clear tape to keep it shut. This however does not affect the camera's performance. when i compare it to one i previously own; this camera is by far better.
customer_reviews.author: alicia hazlewood

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot A495 10.0 MP Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: It's great little camera for my kid. He takes endless pictures and has fun with it. We love the easy use, the speed doesn't matter because it is for my son and he can take time to take photo he likes.
customer_reviews.author: Stone54

customer_reviews.title: Great camera.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely great digital camera with high quality results. Simple design, and perfect productivity for a budget camera. No problem at all, just point ant shoot and get perfect pictures and good video.
customer_reviews.author: StevenG

customer_reviews.title: Canon A495
customer_reviews.text: Nice, very reasonably priced. Bought it because of a high rating by Consumers Report magazine. However, bring along a lot of AA batteries as it runs low on it's 2 batteries very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Doness

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good quick and easy digital camera. I have since bought a DSLR but find when I go for walks I just grab this and the photos come out great. Fits right into a coat pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Regretful purchase
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Was relatively cheap when I bought it (around $80) Cons: Poor photo quality Must keep hand absolutely still Takes legitimately four seconds to focus and a take a picture Not nearly as sleek as it appears in stock photos Bottom Line: Don't buy it.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera to have ready to grab and snap quick pictures.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A great replacement for its worn out sibling. In wonderful shape. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Matt44

customer_reviews.title: Nice For Kids
customer_reviews.text: This was a purchase for my 8 year old granddaughter. The camera has been great for her. It takes nice quality photos, appears to be sturdy, and is just right for a budding photographer!
customer_reviews.author: Lydia Rising

customer_reviews.title: Nice pictures, hungry camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is very easy to set up and use, and the picture quality is very good. The only drawback is that you'd better have plenty of battery on hand. It seems to want a change of batteries every 20-40 shots.
customer_reviews.author: Dreaming of Hawaii

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my mothers birthday gift and she loved it. This is her first digital camera. I just got tired of her pulling out a disposable camera at every event. Now she has a classy camera that is easy to use and takes nice clear pictures. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Shug86

customer_reviews.title: bad craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: I have had nothing but Canon Sureshot cameras for some time now, but this one was a problem and the battery/SD card door was cheaply made and was defective out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Buck1

customer_reviews.title: Canon powershot A495
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this camera for our granddaugter to take on her trip to Colorado. Canon cameras take very good pictures. This camera is small and compact and very easy to use. You can navigate through the menu easily.
customer_reviews.author: oddone

customer_reviews.title: Great photos
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera. This is the second one that we bought. The only flaw in the first one we bought was keeping the battery cover closed. A piece of tape helped.
customer_reviews.author: Buffy Collins

customer_reviews.title: Convenient backup
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to give to families and local friends during the Yap Day festivals in micronesia. I needed something that was easy to use, required minimal instructions and gave reliable results. Something that would be fun for non-photographers. It was perfect for what I was looking for. A friend fell in love with it and I gave the A495 away at the end of my stay, and now I plan to buy another before leaving on a trip to South America.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan Macswain

customer_reviews.title: Love it, love it, love it !!
customer_reviews.text: Last year's CU favorite, and I can see why. Nice big display. Pix especially sharp in macro mode. Bats last long enough for a good shoot. You run out of juice, you replace with spare rechargables. What's the problem? I thought I would have withdrawal pains when my old digital croaked, but the minute I started using this one, I have never looked back. Excellent value at $69. I am thinking of buying another just in case I lose this one.
customer_reviews.author: mtay20

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, wife still uses it regularly even in this world of cameras in all cell phones
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: Great camera at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for an inexpensive but good quality camera for a long time. When I saw this one I couldn't pass it up. So far, I have not been disappointed. The camera is compact, easy to use and takes great pictures.

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for a young child, very easy to use.

customer_reviews.text: Forget about taking any action shots with this camera. It will turn out blurry. It works ok on still shots of scenery but not on moving objects.

This camera is Light weight and just want we wanted to carry around instead of our bigger heavier camera.

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy metal casing
customer_reviews.text: I had this camera only one week before returning it. The designers foolishly designed it so that the required AA batteries are spring-pressed against the flimsy "door" (the one that must be opened to insert the batteries). Part of this door was visually protruding from the camera body by 1/6th inch within a week. Also, this camera is more expensive than it seems, because the AA batteries you've got to buy add up with time. Other cameras come with rechargeable specialized batteries that last years.

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot A495 10.0 MP Digital Camera with 3.3x Optical Zoom and 2.5-Inch LCD (Blue)
product_meta.description:
Color:BlueFROM THE MANUFACTURER


 With its streamlined silhouette and smoothly curved edges, the Canon PowerShot A495 has the compact sophistication and relaxed simplicity that make it a natural for beginners and everyone else who craves style and convenience. The 10.0-megapixel resolution and 3.3x optical zoom make it easy to capture the action in dazzling color and brilliant detail. The DIGIC III Image Processor keeps it all looking sharp. To help you make the most of your creativity, new Scene Modes make your photographs standout. A bright, bold 2.5-inch LCD makes shooting and playback a genuine pleasure. Plus, choose from any of three dazzling colors. 



10.0-megapixel resolution delivers amazing detail Canon PowerShot A495 Highlights 

Easy to use, powerful A-Series camera has 10.0 megapixels and 3.3x optical zoom
With the PowerShot A495, dramatic, personal pictures have never been easier to shoot and share. This 10.0-megapixel camera lets you create impressive large photos of family and friends you'll be proud to display. The high-resolution images taken by the PowerShot A495 can be enlarged up to 13 x 19 inches. 

The PowerShot A495 has a 3.3x optical zoom lens (35mm film equivalent 37-122mm) that let you capture up-close and memorable images. 

Smart AUTO will do the work for you by intelligently selecting the proper settings
Just set the Canon PowerShot A495 to Smart AUTO and you're ready for maximum enjoyment from your picture-taking every time. It's a relaxing and satisfying way to shoot because you can completely concentrate on your subject knowing that the camera has the technical details covered. Advanced Canon technology intelligently analyzes your situation and shooting conditions. Then it automatically selects an appropriate setting from 18 specially defined settings. So whether you're photographing flowers, a captivating sunset, or your friends at the park, you can be confident that you're getting dramatic, memorable images. 

New Scene Modes deliver more creative freedom
The Canon PowerShot A495 gives you even more creative freedom by including new modes made to get the kind of images people talk about. Super Vivid captures the colors you see with your mind's eye, saturating the scene with intense colors. Turn drab scenes into exciting compositions, when dull pinks blaze into brilliant fuchsia and off-yellows suddenly burn bright and hot. Even dark colors become richer with Super Vivid. Sunsets and floral scenes turn into bursts of color, and get your photo noticed. 

Poster Effect combines several similar shades into one color, turning subtle gradations of color into eye-catching, scene-popping contrasts across your image for a unique artistic look. 

Large, clear 2.5-inch LCD
The PowerShot A495's 2.5-inch LCD screen gives you the big picture, whether you're shooting, reviewing or showing off your images. This high-resolution screen offers a crisp, clear and bright picture. It also features Night Display for easy viewing in low light.
